verses.verse: (Lev. 26:4; Ezek. 34:27) And I will multiply the fruit of your trees and the increase of your fields, so that you need never again bear the reproach of famine among the nations.

Then (Ezek. 16:61, 63) you will remember your evil ways and your deeds that were not good; and you (Lev. 26:39; Ezek. 6:9; 20:43) will loathe yourselves in your own sight, for your iniquities and your abominations.
(Deut. 9:5) Not for your sake do I do this,” says the Lord GOD, “let it be known to you. Be ashamed and confounded for your own ways, O house of Israel!”
‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “On the day that I cleanse you from all your iniquities, I will also enable you to dwell in the cities, (Ezek. 36:10) and the ruins shall be rebuilt.
The desolate land shall be tilled instead of lying desolate in the sight of all who pass by.
So they will say, ‘This land that was desolate has become like the garden of (Is. 51:3; Ezek. 28:13; Joel 2:3) Eden; and the wasted, desolate, and ruined cities are now fortified and inhabited.’

Then the nations which are left all around you shall know that I, the LORD, have rebuilt the ruined places and planted what was desolate. (Ezek. 17:24; 22:14; 37:14; Hos. 14:4-9) I, the LORD, have spoken it, and I will do it.”
‘Thus says the Lord GOD: (Ezek. 14:3; 20:3, 31) “I will also let the house of Israel inquire of Me to do this for them: I will (Ezek. 36:10) increase their men like a flock.
Like a flock offered as holy sacrifices, like the flock at Jerusalem on its feast days, so shall the ruined cities be filled with flocks of men. Then they shall know that I am the LORD.” ’ ”

The Dry Bones Live The (Ezek. 1:3) hand of the LORD came upon me and brought me out (Ezek. 3:14; 8:3; 11:24; Acts 8:39) in the Spirit of the LORD, and set me down in the midst of the valley; and it was full of bones.
Then He caused me to pass by them all around, and behold, there were very many in the open valley; and indeed they were very dry.
And He said to me, “Son of man, can these bones live?” So I answered, “O Lord GOD, ((Deut. 32:39; 1 Sam. 2:6; John 5:21; Rom. 4:17; 2 Cor. 1:9)) You know.”
Again He said to me, “Prophesy to these bones, and say to them, ‘O dry bones, hear the word of the LORD!
Thus says the Lord GOD to these bones: “Surely I will (Gen. 2:7; Ps. 104:29, 30; Ezek. 37:9, 10, 14) cause breath to enter into you, and you shall live.

I will put sinews on you and bring flesh upon you, cover you with skin and put breath in you; and you shall live. (Is. 49:23; Ezek. 6:7; 35:12; Joel 2:27; 3:17) Then you shall know that I am the LORD.” ’ ”
So I prophesied as I was commanded; and as I prophesied, there was a noise, and suddenly a rattling; and the bones came together, bone to bone.
Indeed, as I looked, the sinews and the flesh came upon them, and the skin covered them over; but there was no breath in them.

Also He said to me, “Prophesy to the breath, prophesy, son of man, and say to the breath, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: ((Ps. 104:30)) “Come from the four winds, O breath, and breathe on these slain, that they may live.” ’ ”
So I prophesied as He commanded me, (Rev. 11:11) and breath came into them, and they lived, and stood upon their feet, an exceedingly great army.

Then He said to me, “Son of man, these bones are the (Jer. 33:24; Ezek. 36:10) whole house of Israel. They indeed say, (Ps. 141:7; Is. 49:14) ‘Our bones are dry, our hope is lost, and we ourselves are cut off!’

Therefore prophesy and say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “Behold, (Deut. 32:39; 1 Sam. 2:6; Is. 26:19; 66:14; (Dan. 12:2); Hos. 13:14) O My people, I will open your graves and cause you to come up from your graves, and (Ezek. 36:24) bring you into the land of Israel.
Then you shall know that I am the LORD, when I have opened your graves, O My people, and brought you up from your graves.

I (Is. 32:15; Ezek. 36:27; (Joel 2:28, 29); Zech. 12:10) will put My Spirit in you, and you shall live, and I will place you in your own land. Then you shall know that I, the LORD, have spoken it and performed it,” says the LORD.’ ”
One Kingdom, One King Again the word of the LORD came to me, saying,

“As for you, son of man, (Num. 17:2, 3) take a stick for yourself and write on it: ‘For Judah and for (2 Chr. 11:12, 13, 16; 15:9; 30:11, 18) the children of Israel, his companions.’ Then take another stick and write on it, ‘For Joseph, the stick of Ephraim, and for all the house of Israel, his companions.’
Then (Is. 11:13; Jer. 50:4; Ezek. 37:22-24; Hos. 1:11; Zeph. 3:9) join them one to another for yourself into one stick, and they will become one in your hand.
“And when the children of your people speak to you, saying, (Ezek. 12:9; 24:19) ‘Will you not show us what you mean by these?’—

(Zech. 10:6) say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “Surely I will take (Ezek. 37:16, 17) the stick of Joseph, which is in the hand of Ephraim, and the tribes of Israel, his companions; and I will join them with it, with the stick of Judah, and make them one stick, and they will be one in My hand.” ’
